clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Reactogenicity of a Monovalent Conjugated Vaccine Against Haemophilus Influenzae Type b
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase I, Single-arm, Single-center Study to Investigate Safety and Reactogenicity of Monovalent Conjugated Vaccine Against Haemophilus Influenzae Type b in Healthy Children Aged 16 - 20 Months and Infants Aged 2 - 4 Months

brief_summary.textblock: This study will investigate safety and reactogenicity of a monovalent conjugated vaccine against Haemophilus influenzae type b in healthy children

primary_outcome.measure: Rates of local and systemic reactions, adverse events (AEs), and serious adverse events (SAEs) after first vaccination dose will be evaluated.

secondary_outcome.measure: Rates of local and systemic reactions, adverse events (AEs), and serious adverse events (SAEs) after second vaccination dose will be evaluated.

intervention.description: 1 dose monovalent conjugated vaccine against Haemophilus influenzae type b in children aged 16 - 20 months and infants aged 2 - 4 months
